1544106168_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJV.body:
Only works if you have a `\n` character at the end ... so these below do not work:

`printf 'test' | while read a; do echo $a; done;`

`echo -n 'test' | while read a; do echo $a; done;`

Here's another bash command that quite useful when appending something to a file, so instead of writing:

`mv filename filename.bak`

You can write:

`mv filename{,.bak}`
